-- The Authors table stores information about authors
-- Each author has a unique ID, a name, and an optional biography
-- The ID is an auto-incrementing integer
-- The name is a required text field
-- The biography is an optional text field
-- The table is created with the following SQL statement
        CREATE TABLE Authors (
            id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            name TEXT NOT NULL,
            biography TEXT
        )

-- The Publishers table stores information about publishers
-- Each publisher has a unique ID, a name, and an optional address
-- The ID is an auto-incrementing integer
-- The name is a required text field
-- The address is an optional text field
-- The table is created with the following SQL statement
        CREATE TABLE Publishers (
            d INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            name TEXT NOT NULL,
            address TEXT
        )

-- The Books table stores information about books
-- Each book has a unique ID, a title, a price, and an author ID
-- The ID is an auto-incrementing integer
-- The title is a required text field
-- The price is a real number (optional)
-- The author ID is a foreign key referencing the Authors table
-- The table is created with the following SQL statement
        CREATE TABLE Books (
            id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            title TEXT NOT NULL,
            price REAL,
            author_id INTEGER NOT NULL, FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Authors(id)
        )
